question.title: Will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

not_P.title: Will Glenn Youngkin not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. At least one other candidate must be selected as the nominee for this question to resolve as **Yes**. This question is not restricted to the candidates currently listed; other options may be added in the future.

For this question, it is not relevant who receives the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is solely determined by who is selected by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

para_P.title: Is Glenn Youngkin going to be the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will conclude as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Any other candidates will result in a **No**. This question is not limited to the candidates currently identified; additional options may emerge in the future.

For this query, it does not matter who secures the Republican nomination on the day of the 2024 US election; it is determined solely by the selection made by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin also be the nominee?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Glenn Youngkin also selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if Glenn Youngkin is indeed selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, despite Larry Elder also being selected. It resolves as NO if Glenn Youngkin is not selected. Note that this scenario is logically inconsistent under typical single-nominee conditions.

not_P.title: Given Larry Elder is the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin not be the nominee?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Glenn Youngkin not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if Glenn Youngkin is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, despite Larry Elder also being selected. It resolves as NO if Glenn Youngkin is selected. Note that this scenario is logically inconsistent under typical single-nominee conditions.

para_P.title: If Larry Elder becomes the Republican candidate, will Glenn Youngkin be the candidate as well?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Larry Elder is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Then, is Glenn Youngkin also chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: The question resolves as YES if Glenn Youngkin is indeed chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, even though Larry Elder is also chosen. It resolves as NO if Glenn Youngkin is not chosen. Note that this scenario is logically inconsistent under typical single-nominee conditions.

question.title: Given that Larry Elder is not the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that any other candidate is selected. Then, is Glenn Youngkin selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Larry Elder is not selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

not_P.title: Given that Larry Elder is not the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin not be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Larry Elder is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means that any other candidate is selected. Then, is Glenn Youngkin not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is met if Larry Elder is not selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- The outcome resolves as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is not selected as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will resolve as **No**.

para_P.title: If Larry Elder does not become the Republican nominee, will Glenn Youngkin be chosen as the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Larry Elder is not chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This implies that another candidate will be selected. Therefore, is Glenn Youngkin chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election? 

Resolution criteria: 
- The condition is satisfied if Larry Elder is not chosen as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.
- The outcome is determined as **Yes** if Glenn Youngkin is chosen as the nominee by the delegates of the Republican National Convention. All other candidates will result in **No**.

question.title: [Metaculus] Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democra...nomination for President?
question.body:
Will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President?

Resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original resolves, its resolution will be applied to this market automatically. Trustworthy-ish users are encouraged to resolve this market before then if the outcome is known and unambiguous. Feel free to ping @jskf to request early resolution or to report issues.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle.

Fine print and additional background information can be found on Metaculus.

para_P.body:
Will Joe Biden declare by July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the nomination from the Democratic Party for President?

This resolves identically to the original on Metaculus.

(https://www.metaculus.com/questions/question_embed/25755/?theme=dark)Resolution criteria

This question will be answered as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official statement indicating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination from his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election.

For a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and final: it should eliminate any possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the upcoming 2024 election.

If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, then this question will be answered as No.

Additional details and fine print can be found on Metaculus.

Once the original question resolves, its outcome will automatically apply to this market. Users deemed trustworthy are encouraged to resolve this market early if the outcome is known and clear. Please contact @jskf to request early resolution or report any issues.

question.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
question.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

not_P.title: Will Kamala's odds of winning not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model?
not_P.body:
Resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

para_P.title: Will Kamala's chances of victory rise in the upcoming week as per Nate Silver's model?
para_P.body:
Resolves YES if the probability for Harris in the Electoral College according to Nate Silver's model exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO in all other cases.

Link: https://www.natesilver.net/p/nate-silver-2024-president-election-polls-model

question.title: Conditional on Kamala's odds of winning increasing over the next week, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024 that he will not accept the Democratic nomination for President?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala Harris's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. Specifically, this means that the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is greater than 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. 

Then, will Joe Biden announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves as Yes if, prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement that he will not seek and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is not made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

The statement must be unambiguous and conclusive. If such a statement is made by the deadline, this resolves as No.

para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Kamala Harris's chances of victory improve over the next week based on Nate Silver's analysis. In particular, this indicates that the Electoral College likelihood for Harris in Nate Silver's assessment exceeds 46.6% on Friday, August 9th, at 8:40 PM. 

Then, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will refuse the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This will be considered Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign issues a clear, public, official statement that he will not pursue and will not accept his party's nomination for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. The announcement must be clear and definitive. If such an announcement is not made by the deadline, this will be considered No.

question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala's odds of winning do not increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Then is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus.

To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

not_P.body:
Suppose the following is true: Kamala's odds of winning increase over the next week according to Nate Silver's model. This resolves YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's model is >46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. Resolves NO otherwise.

Then is it true that Joe Biden will announce before July 15, 2024, that he will accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus. 

Resolution criteria for Biden's announcement: This question will resolve as Yes if prior to 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a definitive, public, official announcement to the effect that Joe Biden will seek and will accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 cycle. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be unambiguous and conclusive: it should leave no room for the possibility that Biden would not accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. para_P.title: If Kamala's chances of winning remain unchanged over the upcoming week as per Nate Silver's analysis, will Joe Biden declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic nomination for President?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Kamala's chances of winning do not rise over the next week according to Nate Silver's analysis. This will resolve YES if the Electoral College probability for Harris in Nate Silver's analysis is <=46.6% on Friday August 9th at 8:40 PM. It will resolve NO otherwise.

Then, is it accurate to say that Joe Biden will declare before July 15, 2024, that he will decline the Democratic Party's nomination for President? This resolves the same as the original on Metaculus. 

Resolution criteria for Biden's announcement: This question will resolve as Yes if, before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, Joe Biden or his campaign makes a clear, public, official announcement stating that Joe Biden will not pursue and will not accept the nomination of his party for another term as President of the United States in the 2024 election. To qualify for a Yes resolution, the statement must be clear and definitive: it should leave no doubt that Biden would accept the Democratic Party's nomination for President of the United States in the 2024 election cycle. If such a definitive statement is not made before 00:00 Eastern on July 15, 2024, this question will resolve as No.

question.title: Conditional on Donald Trump being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Nikki Haley be the nominee?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this is the case, we want to determine if Nikki Haley can also be the nominee.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO otherwise.

Note: The outcome is only considered if the condition is met. If Donald Trump is the nominee, can Nikki Haley also be the nominee? If not, the outcome is NO.

not_P.body:
This question explores the scenario where Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If this is the case, we want to determine if Nikki Haley cannot also be the nominee.

This inquiry examines the situation in which Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention to be the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Under this circumstance, we aim to find out whether Nikki Haley can similarly be the nominee.

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Criteria for determining the outcome: Resolves YES if Nikki Haley is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. Resolves NO in all other cases.

Note: The outcome is only evaluated if the condition is satisfied. If Donald Trump is indeed the nominee, can Nikki Haley also be the nominee? If this is not the case, the outcome is NO.

Resolution Criteria:
- P: Resolves **Yes** if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
- Q: Resolves **Yes** if Nikki Haley is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee.

Note: This is determined solely by the selection of the delegates of the Republican National Convention, not who receives the nomination on the day of the 2024 US election.

question.title: Will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves negatively.

not_P.title: Will Donald Trump not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
not_P.body:
This question will resolve as "Yes" if, *on* July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office (President, Senate, House of Representatives) under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The removal or block is confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Speculative reports, opinion pieces, or unofficial announcements will not suffice for resolution.

The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024.

Note: The question does not account for legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals that might occur *after* the mentioned date. It strictly pertains to whether Donald Trump has not been removed from any state's primary election ballot for a federal office under the specified grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is removed or blocked from a ballot and then reinstated, such that as of July 15th he is not removed or blocked from any ballot, the question resolves positively.

para_P.title: Is there a possibility that Donald Trump will be excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be considered "Yes" if, as of July 15, 2024:

Donald Trump has been officially excluded or barred from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position (President, Senate, House of Representatives) based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment.

The exclusion or barring is validated through official announcements from state governments, judicial rulings, legal documents, or reliable media coverage. Speculative accounts, opinion articles, or unofficial statements will not qualify for resolution.

The inquiry will be seen as "No" if these criteria are not satisfied by July 15, 2024.

Note: This question does not consider legal disputes, appeals, or any subsequent reversals that may happen after the specified date. It solely addresses whether Donald Trump has been excluded from any state's primary election ballot for a federal position under the stated grounds as of July 15, 2024. If Trump is excluded or barred from a ballot and then reinstated, resulting in him not being excluded or barred from any ballot as of July 15, the inquiry will resolve negatively.

This question will resolve as **Yes** if Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. All other candidates will resolve as **No**. This question may consider new candidates added in the future.

para_P.title: Will Donald Trump secure the Republican nomination for the 2024 Presidential Election in the United States?
para_P.body:
This inquiry will be answered with **Yes** if Donald Trump is chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 Presidential Election in the US. Any other candidates will result in a **No** answer. The possibility of new candidates emerging in the future will also be taken into account.

For the purpose of this question, the identity of the Republican nominee on the day of the 2024 US election is not pertinent; the determination is based solely on who is appointed by the delegates of the [Republican National Convention](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Republican_National_Convention).

question.title: Given Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will he be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. 

Then, will Donald Trump be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Donald Trump must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
- For the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date.

not_P.title: Given Donald Trump is the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will he not be removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

- For the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has not been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or block must be confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports.
- The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are met as of July 15, 2024. The question does not consider legal battles, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump becomes the Republican candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will he face removal or exclusion from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?

Resolution criteria:
- For the condition: Donald Trump must be chosen by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the candidate.
- For the outcome: Resolves "Yes" if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or excluded from the primary election ballot in any U.S. state for a federal position under the provisions of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment. The removal or exclusion must be substantiated through official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documentation, or reliable media reports.
- The question will resolve as "No" if these conditions are not satisfied as of July 15, 2024. The question does not take into account legal disputes, appeals, or subsequent reversals after this date.

question.title: Given Donald Trump is not the Republican nominee, will he be removed or blocked from any primary ballot under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
question.body:
Suppose the following is true: Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This means any other candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it true that Donald Trump will have been removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under Section 3 of the 14th Amendment as of July 15, 2024?

Resolution criteria for the condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Resolves YES if, on July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially removed or blocked from the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office under the grounds of Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, confirmed through official state government announcements, court decisions, legal documentation, or credible media reports. Resolves NO otherwise.

para_P.title: If Donald Trump is not the Republican nominee, will he be disqualified or prevented from appearing on any primary ballot according to Section 3 of the 14th Amendment?
para_P.body:
Assuming the following holds true: Donald Trump is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election. This indicates that another candidate is selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention.

Then, is it accurate to say that Donald Trump will have been disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office in accordance with Section 3 of the 14th Amendment by July 15, 2024?

Criteria for resolving the condition: Resolves YES if Donald Trump is not chosen by the Republican National Convention as the candidate for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Criteria for resolving the outcome: Resolves YES if, by July 15, 2024, Donald Trump has been officially disqualified or prevented from appearing on the primary election ballot of any U.S. state for a federal office based on Section 3 of the 14th Amendment, as confirmed through official state government announcements, court rulings, legal documents, or reliable media sources. Resolves NO otherwise.

question.title: Conditional on Asa Hutchinson being the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election, will Donald Trump Jr. be the nominee?
question.body:
This question explores the scenario where Asa Hutchinson is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election. If Asa Hutchinson is indeed the nominee, then this question asks whether Donald Trump Jr. could also be the nominee.

Resolution criteria for the condition: Asa Hutchinson must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

Resolution criteria for the outcome: Donald Trump Jr. must be selected by the delegates of the Republican National Convention as the nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election.

If Asa Hutchinson is the nominee, then Donald Trump Jr. cannot be, as only one candidate can be selected. Therefore, if the condition is met, the outcome will resolve as **No**.

question.title: Given Asa Hutchinson is not the Republican nominee, will Donald Trump Jr. be the Republican nominee for the 2024 US Presidential Election?

Resolution criteria: 
- P: Resolves YES if Asa Hutchinson is not selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
- Q: Resolves YES if Donald Trump Jr. is selected by the Republican National Convention as the nominee.
